metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition

requirements.description: This Section applies to roof spaces
requirements.exact_quote: This Section applies to roof spaces

requirements.description: Minimum access opening size for attic or roof space (550 mm by 900 mm)
requirements.exact_quote: An access opening of not less than 550 mm by 900 mm shall be provided to each attic or roof space

requirements.description: Access opening may be reduced to 500 mm by 700 mm where roof space serves only one dwelling unit
requirements.exact_quote: where the roof space serves only one dwelling unit, to not less than 500 mm by 700 mm
conditions: roof space serves single dwelling unit

requirements.description: No access required where roof slope does not exceed 1 in 6 and maximum height from top of ceiling frame to underside of roof sheathing is 600 mm or less
requirements.exact_quote: An attic or roof space access need not be provided where the roof slope does not exceed 1 in 6 and the maximum height from the top of the ceiling frame members to the underside of roof sheathing is not more than 600 mm

requirements.description: Maximum height from ceiling frame to roof sheathing for access exemption
requirements.exact_quote: the maximum height from the top of the ceiling frame members to the underside of roof sheathing is not more than 600 mm

requirements.description: Maximum roof slope (1 in 6) for access exemption
requirements.exact_quote: the roof slope does not exceed 1 in 6

requirements.description: Access openings to attics and roof spaces shall be located so that all portions of the space are accessible
requirements.exact_quote: Access openings to attics and roof spaces shall be located so that all portions of the space are accessible

requirements.description: Unheated roof spaces shall be ventilated with vent area of not less than 1/300 of insulated ceiling area
requirements.exact_quote: Unheated roof spaces shall have a vent area of not less than 1/300 of the insulated ceiling area

requirements.description: Vents shall be distributed so as to provide for both high-level and low-level ventilation
requirements.exact_quote: The vents required in Sentence (1) shall be distributed so as to provide for both high-level and low-level ventilation

requirements.description: Cathedral ceilings shall have a clear ventilation space of not less than 63 mm between the underside of roof sheathing and top of insulation
requirements.exact_quote: cathedral ceilings shall have a clear ventilation space of not less than 63 mm between the underside of the roof sheathing and the top of the insulation

requirements.description: Low-level vents shall be located in the lower third of the roof space
requirements.exact_quote: low-level vents shall be located in the lower third of the roof space

requirements.description: High-level vents shall be located in the upper third of the roof space
requirements.exact_quote: high-level vents shall be located in the upper third of the roof space

requirements.description: The ratio of low-level to high-level vent area shall be not more than 1 to 1.5
requirements.exact_quote: the ratio of low-level to high-level vent area shall be not more than 1 to 1.5

requirements.description: Heated roof spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with Section 9.32
requirements.exact_quote: Heated roof spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with Section 9.32
